required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Economic and Clinical Outcomes of (Whole Exome) Sequencing in Tapestry
clinical_study.official_title: ECOST = Economic and Clinical Outcomes of (Whole Exome) Sequencing in Tapestry

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this research is to learn more about the impact of genetic testing on healthcare costs, clinical care, and quality of life.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in quality of life measured through adjusted years.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Every 12 months for 5 years after enrollment.
primary_outcome.description: Measuring quality of life through adjusted years due to learning Tapestry test results.

primary_outcome.measure: Disease incidence measured by disease count per 100 participants.
primary_outcome.description: Number of disease incidences per 100 participants.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in utilization measured by total number of office visits, hospital stays, ER visits, and length of visits.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Every 12 months for 5 years after enrollment.
primary_outcome.description: Composite of: Number of Office-based visits. Number of Hospital stays and length of visits. Number of ER visits.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in costs measured by disease related and all-cost related costs.
primary_outcome.time_frame: Every 12 months for 5 years after enrollment.
primary_outcome.description: Cost Composite of: Disease-related costs. Disease-related costs by utilization category. All-cause costs. All-cause costs by utilization category.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in quality of life measured through adjusted years from subgroups.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 12 months for 5 years after enrollment.
secondary_outcome.description: Measuring quality of life through adjusted years due to learning Tapestry test results categorized by subgroups: minority races, 65 years and older, etc.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in quality of life measured through adjusted years from different scenarios.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 12 months for 5 years after enrollment.
secondary_outcome.description: Measuring quality of life through adjusted years due to learning Tapestry test results categorized by different scenarios: disease comorbidities, patient income, education, adherence to medical orders, etc.
Number of disease incidences per 100 hundred participants categorized by subgroups: minority races, 65 years and older, etc.
Number of disease incidences per 100 hundred participants categorized by different scenarios: disease comorbidities, patient income, education, adherence to medical orders, etc.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 12 months for 5 years after enrollment.
secondary_outcome.description: Composite of: Number of Office-based visits. Number of Hospital stays and length of visits. Number of ER visits. All categorized by subgroups: minority races, 65 years and older, etc.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in utilization from different scenarios.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 12 months for 5 years after enrollment.
secondary_outcome.description: Composite of: Number of Office-based visits. Number of Hospital stays and length of visits. Number of ER visits. All categorized by different scenarios: disease comorbidities, patient income, education, adherence to medical orders, etc.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 12 months for 5 years after enrollment.
secondary_outcome.description: All-cause costs. All-cause costs by utilization category. All categorized by subgroups: minority races, 65 years and older, etc.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in costs from different scenarios.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Every 12 months for 5 years after enrollment.
secondary_outcome.description: All-cause costs. All-cause costs by utilization category. All categorized by different scenarios: disease comorbidities, patient income, education, adherence to medical orders, etc.

study_pop.textblock: The study population will include participants of the Tapestry study, which is an ongoing project aimed at studying the genetic risk factors that impact medical care of patients at Mayo Clinic. This study will include the first 15,000 Tapestry patients who received results of 11 genes (incidental findings) after undergoing WES using a saliva sample and were enrolled January 2020 onwards. Chart review of up to 85,000 records will accompany the 15,000 enrolled and completing surveys for a total of 100,000 accrued.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Tapestry patients who have received genetic results, regardless of positive or negative testing results.
- Age of 18 and older.
- Patients with an established Mayo Clinic provider prior to their enrollment in Tapestry.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Individuals less than 18 years old.
- Patients without capacity to consent (i.e., needing legal authorized representatives).
- Prisoners.
- Subjects eligible for chart review, without a Minnesota Research Authorization on record.

clinical_study.keyword: Quality of life - adjusted life years
